meanings.definition: Not having distinct or separate parts
meanings.sent1: The undifferentiated colors blended together to form a new shade.
meanings.sent2: The artist used undifferentiated strokes to create a soft, flowing effect.
meanings.sent3: The undifferentiated puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: In the fog, the undifferentiated shapes seemed to morph into mysterious creatures.
meanings.sent5: The undifferentiated sounds of the forest at night were both eerie and calming.

meanings.sent1: The undifferentiated skills of the beginner required further training.
meanings.sent2: The undifferentiated knowledge of the subject made it hard to grasp the details.
meanings.sent3: His undifferentiated cooking style resulted in a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The undifferentiated plants in the garden hinted at a lack of care and attention.
meanings.sent5: The undifferentiated tools in the box were a jumble of possibilities waiting to be explored.

meanings.sent1: The undifferentiated patterns on the fabric looked like a random mix of shapes.
meanings.sent2: The undifferentiated flavors of the soup left a bland taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The undifferentiated personalities in the group made it hard to pick a leader.
meanings.sent4: The undifferentiated voices in the crowd merged into a cacophony of noise.
meanings.sent5: The undifferentiated scents in the room created a confusing blend of fragrances.
